programme.title: Local Love
programme.sub-title: Local Love: Avoiding The Strike Zone
programme.desc: Ashley is young, fun and single in Louisville, but can’t seem to find the right guy – yet. Enter three local singles to show her the town with a trip to the batting cages, a game of tennis and a lesson in blowing glass.

programme.title: The Lost Children of Carlisle
programme.desc: A powerful look at the history of Native American boarding schools as told through the stories of tribal members and their surviving family members, who endured an educational system founded on the concept “Kill the Indian in him, and save the man.”

programme.title: Game On: Fight for the Kings
programme.desc: Game On: Fight for the Kings is a KCRA 3 documentary with never-before-heard stories of the four-month fight, the friendships garnered between the rival cities, and Sacramento doing the unimaginable: winning the battle for the Kings.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.sub-title: Chaos & Kindness: Blindfolded Batting Cage Blunder
programme.desc: Dreams come true while visiting a long-time fan and cancer survivor on their way to Louisville. Ryan wears a blindfold during a batting cage challenge with Jimmy, and a couple living behind the batting cage receive help getting back on their feet.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: Host Frank Nicotero asks contestants questions about the wildest, wackiest news stories. In "Peculiar Properties," he quizzes locals about a house shaped like apparel, a teeny tiny house and a basement with a shocking surprise.

programme.title: Heroes On Call
programme.sub-title: Heroes On Call: The Forgotten Story of America's First Paramedics
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Americans were dying at shocking rates due to inadequate emergency care. Enter Freedom House Ambulance Service: the first paramedics unit in the U.S., run and staffed by Black men and women. This is the origin story of EMS.

programme.title: On The Job
programme.sub-title: On The Job: Brendan Finds Beasts in the Orange Groves
programme.desc: Brendan explores a beautiful orange grove while giving a tour on a school bus monster truck, pampers some pals at a European beer spa, and works the late-shift to make the best Philly cheesesteak outside the City of Brotherly Love.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: Botched Crimes
programme.desc: Sometimes, would-be criminals are their own worst enemies. This episode highlights crime “fails,” and the officers - and ordinary civilians - who save the day.

programme.title: Mo Gaba: Spirit Lives Forever
programme.desc: How a child living with cancer changed the Baltimore sports community forever.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.sub-title: Finding Adventure: Settling Down But Never Settling
programme.desc: Jessie Fiacco is a single mother and nurse, who during the pandemic made home visits. But Jessie hasn’t made time for herself. Luckily for her, Kinga is in town to show Jessie she doesn’t have to travel far to get far out.

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: Beach-inspired resin art in Boston, and elaborate charcuterie boards in Omaha.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.sub-title: Maker Nation Challenge: Designers Wow Judges with Mardi Gras Marvels
programme.desc: Costumes are a part of the fabric that makes up New Orleans. As three local designers will find out – nothing is easy in the Big Easy as they compete in creating one-of-a-kind costumes inspired by the Crescent City and the river that shapes it.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: Hide & Seek
programme.desc: You can run. You can hide. But chances are, they’re still gonna find you. These are some of the wildest and most bizarre police captures on record.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Stitch recognizes the feel-good, do-good and all-around good from across the country. This episode shares stories of Americans spreading kindness, from kids making a difference to stories of people helping veterans in need.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.sub-title: Plate It! Baltimore: Fast Food Gets Finessed
programme.desc: Skip the drive-through! Chefs Ericka Loyal and Josh Vecchiolla are finessing their favorite classic fast food dishes. Which chef's spin will win the judges over?

programme.title: Weathering the Storm
programme.sub-title: Weathering the Storm: Couple Faces Historic Tornado on Eve of Wedding
programme.desc: On December 10, 2021, a violent tornado outbreak hit western Kentucky. It was the deadliest weather event in the history of the Commonwealth. But as families faced a bleak holiday season, hope emerged in surprising ways.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: The Pike County Massacre
programme.desc: After eight members of one family were killed in their homes in a single night, residents of the devastated Ohio community were left to wonder if they were next.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.sub-title: Chaos & Kindness: Band Brings Smile Back To Friend With Cerebral Palsy
programme.desc: This story will put a smile on your face. The team helps one of their dearest friends get his greatest wish: a brand new smile.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.sub-title: Local Love: Professor of Business Seeks Masters in Love
programme.desc: Lacee is a driven, successful professor who's ready to put down her books and pick up her love life. Who will get top marks for her affection?

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.sub-title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot: Acclaimed Screenwriter, Fashion MC, & Hip Influencer Dole Out Top Hot Spots
programme.desc: Why is Kansas City's fashion scene thriving? Craving a horchata latte? Best pizza on planet Earth? Local experts Jordan Gallant, Jasmine Green, and Aaron Rahsaan Thomas have all the answers, including where to go for a new hairstyle and a pep talk.

programme.title: Unbelievable
programme.desc: Brace yourself for heart-stopping heroics as rescuers leap into action! A semi-truck teeters dangerously over the Ohio River, a devastating gas explosion reduces homes to rubble, and a capsized cargo ship leaves its crew fighting for survival.

programme.title: Key Bridge Disaster: Reflect, Recover, Rebuild
programme.desc: "Key Bridge Disaster: Reflect, Recover, Rebuild," examines the lives impacted in the hours, days and months following the collapse, telling the stories of first responders, workers at the Port of Baltimore, business owners and employees, and the people living in nearby communities.

programme.title: Juvenile Lifers: Road to Redemption
programme.desc: (2019) Juvenile Lifers: Road to Redemption focuses on people who were sentenced to life in prison as juveniles. WGAL News 8's Matt Barcaro examines how these these former offenders are re-entering society and the reaction from victims' families.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: Huge Evidence Hauls Seen on the Force
programme.desc: Whether it’s gathering thousands of mysterious, colorful packets stuffed in a store’s ceiling or valuable wildlife slithering to freedom, investigators must be ready to decisively face a range of mammoth tasks in the field.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.sub-title: My Perfect Day with Woman's Day: Caring Crusader Enjoys Paw-tastic Surprises at Every Turn
programme.desc: Scott's life revolves around everyone's favorite four-legged friends, from rescuing and caring for countless dogs, his spirit is unwavering. Today Meaghan gives back a day full of moments for him and his beloved canine companion.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Comedians, podcasters and craft beer enthusiasts Ed Bailey and Day Bracey explore hot spots, hidden gems and the best places to grab a cold brew in the 'Burgh.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: Each episode of this documentary series features incredible sports stories from iconic American cities. From gritty underdog victories to passionate unlikely match-ups, the series proves that sports are so much more than a pastime.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: In this game show, comedian Frank Nicotero hits the streets to ask people questions inspired by the wildest news stories for a chance at winning a cash prize. These real-life stories with unreal outcomes will make you say, “Wait, What Happened?"

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.sub-title: What's On The Menu, Baltimore? Comfort Food
programme.desc: Loosen that belt: Today we're filling up on comforting classics. From thick focaccia pizza to the juiciest smoked brisket, we guarantee there won't be room for dessert.

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.sub-title: America's Most Delish Midwest: 10 Unexpected Eats with Midwest Flair
programme.desc: Uncover the Midwest's unexpected. From quirky to inventive flavor mash-ups like the bulgogi burger to the questionable sour cream & raisin pie, see how the area crafts some interesting but delightful culinary concoctions.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: Havoc-Wreaking Hackers
programme.desc: Cyber-burglars, a dangerous mix of con artist and geek, wreak havoc on the technologically vulnerable. Our experts offer tips to spot such high-tech trickery before it's too late.

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.desc: Join WNBA player and Olympian Angel McCoughtry as she shows us the people and places that put Baltimore on the map. From sailing the Chesapeake, to sampling street foods, McCoughtry pulls back the curtain on what makes the Charm City so special.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Comedians, podcasters and craft beer enthusiasts Ed Bailey and Day Bracey explore hot spots, hidden gems and the best places to grab a cold brew in the 'Burgh.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: Each episode of this documentary series features incredible sports stories from iconic American cities. From gritty underdog victories to passionate unlikely match-ups, the series proves that sports are so much more than a pastime.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: In this game show, comedian Frank Nicotero hits the streets to ask people questions inspired by the wildest news stories for a chance at winning a cash prize. These real-life stories with unreal outcomes will make you say, “Wait, What Happened?"

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: No one knows a city like the locals who live there. This series taps into the insider knowledge of notable figures including musicians, athletes, chefs, artists, influencers, and others who share their best spots to hit up in the city.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Host and comedic actor Amy Brassette McKeon challenges two sets of couples to pass a good time on a dime in their city. Find out which couple will experience the most amazing date for under fifty bucks.

programme.title: Underdog Uprising
programme.desc: Every game day, fans pour into the stands to cheer on New Mexico's soccer team. But these are no ordinary supporters. From the Curse, to Sektor 114, to the Black Diamonds these fans are making New Mexico United.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.
